name: Longsword
description: Longswords have good accuracy, damage, and parrying ability, helping their bearer excel in every battle.

name: Katana
description: A curved blade attributed mystical power that can make effortless quick slices with impressive accuracy.

name: Broadsword
description: A wide-bladed two-handed sword that mixes the savagery of an axe with the precision of a sword.

name: Rapier
description: An elegant dueling weapon that is sharp all along its blade; ideal for thrusting attacks and parries.

name: Shortsword
description: Not quite a knife or a sword, Shortswords are heavier than they look, but can still be swung quickly.

name: Carving Knife
description: This sharpened chef's implement is just as good at slicing up a steak as it is slashing living flesh.

name: Handaxe
description: Some call them tomahawks, others hunga munga; this is a throwing axe by any name.

name: Hatchet
description: A medium-sized axe balanced for carving wood rather than throwing, it can carve flesh just as well.

name: Greataxe
description: It's hard to beat this two-handed axe when it comes to overkill; the destruction these wreak is legendary.

name: Halberd
description: It's an axe on a pole, the pole ends in a spear, and there's also a hook on the pole; clearly this is versatile.

name: Glaive
description: Anything blade-like attached to the end of a pole, for sweeping slices at a comfortable distance.

name: Cape
description: Among the least effective ways to kill someone, but great for confusing or disarming foes while keeping your hands free.

name: Hammer
description: A heavy one-handed tool converted into a weapon of war that is especially strong against armor.

name: Maul
description: A brutal two-handed sledgehammer that seems impractical against all but the slowest foes -- or monsters.

name: Club
description: A plain-old heavy stick that can be swung with surprising speed, and can be passed off as a normal twig.

name: Mace
description: Not just any stick, this one's made of solid metal, and can pulverize armor with a good wallop.

name: Pole
description: Whether an collapsible pole or just a piece of bamboo, a Pole is excellent at whacking multiple foes.

name: Taiaha
description: An unusual mix of a spear's pointed tip with a shield-shaped haft, usually made entirely from hard wood.

name: Shortspear
description: Lighter than a Lance and heavier than a Javelin, a Shortspear can be effectively wielded at close to medium range.

name: Lance
description: An uncommon weapon, the Lance can't attack a close-by enemy but can annihilate further-away foes.

name: Leaf Spear
description: A heavier mid-length spear with a broad leaf-shaped blade at the end; it can be used for slicing and stabbing alike.

name: Nunchaku
description: A martial-arts weapon consisting of two club-like bars connected with a short chain; excellent for defensive use.

name: Section Staff
description: A series of three or more wooden rods connected with chains; originally meant for threshing rice but deadly when swung.

name: Hand Flail
description: A nasty spiked ball whipped around on a heavy chain; it's simply brutal against armored foes.

name: Meteor Flail
description: A small, heavy weight on the end of a long vine or rope; making one is easy, but fighting with one is very hard.

name: Whip
description: A leather bullwhip that's flexible enough to knock a weapon from the hands of nearby opponents.

name: Chain
description: A metal chain that can be spun to deliver painful strikes, and can wrap around an enemy's weapon to relieve him of it.

name: Sai
description: A martial-arts weapon with three curving spikes that provide ample ability to disarm foes.

name: Trident
description: A fishing spear adapted for gladiatorial and maritime combat, the trident has three barbed prongs on a mid-size pole.

name: Sickle
description: A lightweight, deeply-curved blade that can be used for severing plant roots, or a foe's limbs, as well as disarming.

name: Khopesh
description: A sword-like weapon with a heavy blade that goes straight and then curves; challenging to wield and to confront.

name: Scythe
description: A hook-bladed farming tool meant for slicing wide swaths of grain, adapted to slicing wide swaths in necks.

name: Light Shield
description: A shield that's meant for actively parrying and blocking enemy attacks, mixing in quick jabs with the edge of the shield.

name: Heavy Shield
description: A large shield that's effective at defending even while barely moving, but it's hard to precisely wield one.
